result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven O. Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant, Steven O. Johnson, in custody, appeared with Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki.  Defendant in custody.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(2:16)   MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
State - argues sentencing - still owes costs which requests made judgment - 12 mo jail 13CF337, 9 mo 14CF346 concurrent, 90 days on 15CF163 - credit 143 days 13CF337, 44 days 14CF346, 44 days 15CF163
Rivard - no objection to monetary amounts, as far as credit requests time served - has credit of 307 days
Rivard - moves to offer Exh 1 - list of credit time from jail personnel - recd - have reviewed court minutes and it shows in 15CF163 there were 99 days credit
State - addresses credit time 15CF163 would be 91 days, it's a signature bond in 14CF346 wouldn't get credit if on sign bond
Rivard - 74 days credit in 13CF337 but credit was on another older case - he's at 300 and some days and requests time served
State - 13CF337 143 days credit, 14CF346 135 days credit, 15CF163 44 days credit
Rivard plus the 91 days shown on joc - deft requests furlough to get auto

COURT:
13CF337 - 12 months jail - credit 143 days 

14CF346 - 9 months jail concurrent to 13CF337 - credit 135 days

15CF163 - 90 days jail concurrent to 13CF337 & 14CF346 - credit 143 days
$2053.96 unpaid restitution made judgment - DA will file restitution form - J & S
 Denies furlough - can have huber
contacted Julie Webers office for scheduling and they indicated she would not be representing him on the revocation
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 25, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
Per conversation w/defendant, upon payment of $600, defendant can start payment plan and we will vacate suspension
Rest check

Restitution

State - argues sentence - rest $2447.39 - requests incarceration 6 mo jail - Ct 1 13cf337 w/held 2 yrs prob, 6 mo jail, rest worksheets filed, cc $268, $250, $10 drug surchg - Ct 1 15cf163 w/held sent 2 yrs prob, rest, conc, $268 cc, $250 dna surchg - ct 3 14CF346 w/held 1 yr prob., conc. $243 cc, $200 dna suchg $10 drug - REST AMT $2151.83
